alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Chena River Upstream of the Moose Creek Dam. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas such as parking lots, boat launches, picnic areas and campgrounds in the Chena River Recreation area. Low lying roads and driveways near the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam may become impassable. Logs and debris will float down the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 PM AKDT, Recent heavy rainfall is causing high water and minor flooding on the Upper Chena River. The river crested at the Mile 38 bridge this morning, and will crest this evening at Hunts Creek, and at the Moose Creek Dam late tonight or early Friday. Additional precipitation expected tonight will keep the water level high into Saturday. - For Chena River below Hunts Creek: At 2:00pm the stage was 15.92 feet. - For Chena River near Two Rivers: At 2:00pm the stage was 19.83 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People along the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam should prepare for minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
